intro: Sida alnifolia, commonly known as silverleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is an annual herb that typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas. The plant has small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Sida alnifolia is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. It is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
